community.heading: What
community.description: Check out our flagship software PySyft on Github: Perform data science on data that remains in someone else's server

community.heading: Where
community.description: Join our vibrant slack community with over 16,000+ members today!

community.heading: Who
community.description: We are hiring! Connect with us on Linkedin and see available job postings.

mainPartnerships.alt: UK AI Safety Institute (Formerly UK Frontier AI Taskforce)

collaborations.heading: Christchurch Call Initiative on Algorithmic Outcomes
collaborations.description: The Christchurch Call is a community of over 120 governments, online service providers, and civil society organisations acting together to eliminate terrorist and violent extremist content online, "Working with an open-source non-profit organisation called OpenMined, the Algorithms Initiative will develop and test ground-breaking privacy-enhancing software infrastructure to address those challenges and help us move forward work under the Call."

collaborations.alt: UK Frontier AI Taskforce (Now UK AI Safety Institute)
collaborations.heading: UK AI Safety Institute (formerly the Frontier AI Taskforce)
collaborations.description: The Institute is the first state-backed organisation focused on advanced AI safety for the public interest. Its mission is to minimise surprise to the UK and humanity from rapid and unexpected advances in AI, "We are working with OpenMined to develop and deploy technical infrastructure that will facilitate AI safety research across governments and AI research organisations."

collaborations.alt: NATIONAL STRATEGY TO ADVANCE PRIVACY-PRESERVING DATA SHARING AND ANALYTICS
collaborations.heading: United Nations and US Census Bureau (feat. in USA's National Strategy Report)
collaborations.description: "In 2022, the UN PET Lab ran a pilot study to test the ability to query data across a network made up of the countries and the UN without seeing the data itself. They did this by deploying an open-source software called PySyft and loading in open trade data..."
